sentence.Network_en: I finally reached what we laughingly call civilization.
sentence.Network_cn: 我终于到了我们戏称为文明之地的地方。
他笑着说出了那个故事.

sentence.Network_en: I spent much of what I laughingly call "the holidays" working through 621 pages of typescript.
sentence.Network_cn: 我把我戏称为“假日”的大部分时间都花在那621页的打字稿上了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 笑字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 笑不唧儿〖 smile〗 笑哈哈〖 laughingheartily;laughingly;withalaugh〗 笑呵呵〖 smilingly〗.
laughing 可笑的laughingly 笑着地laughingstock 笑柄
母亲当然是笑着 ( laughingly)问的。Marc的 “撒娇”,其实是对母亲的关爱的一种理解,一种感谢,间或也是对自己过去行为的一种弥补,轻巧.

list.abs: one night at a party , Karen laughingly called Mark a mama's boy who had never grown up .某晚的一次聚会上，凯伦笑称马克是一个永远长不大、需要妈妈呵护的孩子。
reply laboriously 努力地答复reply laughingly 笑着答复reply listlessly 无精打采地答复
command justly 公正地指挥command laughingly 开玩笑地指挥command shrilly 刺耳地指挥
Well , this is what is laughingly known as my apartment ., 好的 , 这就是被戏称为我的公寓的地方.

entry.tran: 戏弄地；开玩笑地；可笑地
entry.def: If you laughingly refer to something with a particular name or description, the description is not appropriate and you think that this is either amusing or annoying.

example.ex: I spent much of what I laughingly call 'the holidays' working through 621 pages of typescript...
example.tran: 我把我戏称为“假日”的大部分时间都花在那621页的打字稿上了。

example.ex: What I laughingly refer to as my garden is a corner lot by our postage-stamp size house.
example.tran: 我戏称为花园的地方，是我们家那豆腐块大小的屋子旁边的一个犄角旮旯。

auth_sentence.content: On one occasion my boss laughingly told me about what he had been doing for some time.

auth_sentence.content: He says laughingly that he's sprouted "quite a few gray hairs" since, leading the upscale equivalent of a military operation.

auth_sentence.content: Faced with a challenge to his vision last week, President Obama laughingly replied to these people: Go for it.
